resources.string: The Home Page or Main Activity displays four options for the user.\n User may select anywhere within the corresponding button/text area.\n Each button is the entire colored text area enclosing the label.

The first TextViews allows user to return to the home activity.
 The next several TextViews will displays info about the currently playing song.
 If nothing is playing, the info from the last file played will display.
 User may select a check box to add the current file to the favorites list.
 The user may select the play/stop button to start or stop playing the current file.
 If current file is not the desired one, user can user button to go to select
 a file from the library. 
 This functionality will be implemented using the PlaySong class.
Now Playing your selected media file:
Toggle Button to Start or Stop playing the queued file.

The first TextViews/Button allows the user to return to the home activity.
 The "Top 10" TextView/Button displays the 10 most recently played files.
 The Go to Full Media Catalog takes user to the full list of available files.
 This functionality will be implemented using the MediaCategories class.
 The Open Player option allows user to open the player activity. 
 If a selection is make from either list, it will be loaded into the Player.
 If no selection is made, the Player will open with the last played file still loaded.

The first TextViews/Button allows the user to return to the home activity.
 (Not visible to user): The Google Pay library to list of dependencies in the app. The Ready To Checkout Checkbox must be checked in order for Google Play Button to appear.
 Once the checkbox is checked, the Google Pay API runs the checkout and cc payment sequence.
 This functionality will be implemented using the BuyNow class.
OOPS! Not ready to buy yet: Please take me back!
Use Google Pay to buy songs:
1. User selects a song to buy on Goggle Play.
2. After a selection is made, the user MUST FIRST tick the\n checkboxReadyToPay box in order to see the GPay Button appear.
3. Once it appears, user clicks on the GPay button to begin the\n checkout sequence of the GPay API starting with the loadPaymentData(request) process.
4. Payment data object is returned as an Activity result and token.
